task.title: Deploying an API
task.shortdesc: Deploy an API on the APIs Deployments page to configure and deploy an API.

taskbody.prereq: Once you have created at least one API Service/Proxy component in , you can use to deploy the API to an environment and publish it.

step.cmd: In the row of the table that has the API that you want to deploy on the APIs page, click Manage.
To add an available environment for the API deployment configuration, click Add Deployment Configuration and select an environment from the list.

stepresult.p: The environment that you selected is shown in the table with a Draft status (Environment is in draft status.).

step.cmd: Change the Authentication from Atom Controlled to an external provider, and specify an Authentication Source.
If the Authentication is not listed as Atom Controlled, add one or more Contracts to the API.
On the Actions drop-down menu, click Deploy.
Add any deployment notes and click Deploy.

stepresult.p: A message that the API has been successfully deployed appears. The status is changed to Deployed (API is deployed.) to indicate that the latest version of the API is deployed.

step.cmd: If the Status has an orange indicator in the top right corner ( Newest version of API Service/Proxy component is not deployed. ), a newer version of the API Service/Proxy component was saved in and has not been deployed. To deploy the most recent version:

substep.cmd: In the Actions drop-down menu, click Deploy Most Recent.
Add any deployment notes and click Deploy.

stepresult.p: A message that the API has been successfully deployed appears.

step.cmd: If you accidentally deploy an API to the wrong environment, you can remove the configuration to delete the deployment. To remove a configuration:

substep.cmd: On the Status drop-down menu, click Remove Configuration.
In the confirmation dialog, click OK.
